result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rudy Erik Lugo

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim P.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.

3:43 PM Defendant Rudy Erik Lugo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Rudy Erik Lugo.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim P.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
